title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 01 March 2016 - XWiki
content:
<cjd> has joined #xwiki  
00:31 <abusenius\_> has quit  
02:33 <cjd\_> has joined #xwiki  
02:33 <cjd> has quit  
05:54 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
05:58 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
06:04 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
07:16 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:28 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> has joined #xwiki  
07:28 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> Hi  
07:29 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> I already setup xwiki 7.4.2 using ubuntu, all setup done and import data using XAR, but at theheader of wiki page there is no button to navigate and add page or space  
07:33 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
07:51 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
07:55 <tmortagne> has quit  
08:04 <cjd\_> has quit  
08:04 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:08 <pakhandibaba> has joined #xwiki  
08:08 <pakhandibaba> Hi  
08:08 <pakhandibaba> I am interested in the Blame view project.  
08:08 <pakhandibaba> How can I start contributing to it?  
08:18 <mflorea> has quit  
08:35 <vmassol> has quit  
08:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:43 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:48 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> has quit  
08:48 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <vmassol> hi pakhandibaba  
10:05 <vmassol> great :)  
10:06 <vmassol> you should start by reading http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/  
10:06 <vmassol> (you'll find a link pointing to http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/Guidelines on that page)  
10:07 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <vmassol> this blame view project is mentored by Eduard Moraru who'll be online here a bit later  
10:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: did we propose implementing in-page translating as a gsoc project?  
10:09 <vmassol> ah yes it's tehre  
10:09 <vmassol> cool  
10:09 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/Translationincontext2016  
10:09 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <pakhandibaba> vmassol, thank you  
10:14 <pakhandibaba> I know python, c++, html, css, js and mysql  
10:14 <pakhandibaba> can you suggest me some more projects suitable for me.  
10:17 <vmassol> pakhandibaba: no java?  
10:17 <pakhandibaba> I dont know java at this point but I can learn  
10:18 <vmassol> Then I can think of the following which don't require java:  
10:18 <vmassol> - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/GlossaryApplication2016  
10:18 <vmassol> - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/Translationincontext2016  
10:19 <vmassol> at the moment those are the two I can that could require little or no java  
10:19 <vmassol> s/I can/I can see  
10:20 <pakhandibaba> vmassol, What about the blame view ?  
10:21 <Enygma`> Hi pakhandibaba  
10:21 <pakhandibaba> Hi Enygma`  
10:22 <Enygma`> as you can see in the description of the project at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/BlameView you would need to work with web technologies and a templating language  
10:22 <pakhandibaba> Enygma`, I know html, css, js and a bit of php.  
10:23 <pakhandibaba> I have also made a hostel portal in python using web2py.  
10:23 <Enygma`> you should have a quick look over Apache Velocity, the templating language we use in XWiki  
10:23 <vmassol> pakhandibaba: honestly without java experience any project is going to be hard  
10:24 <Enygma`> the blame view is mostly UI work, so you don`t really need java on this one  
10:24 <pakhandibaba> that is the reason I selected this project  
10:24 <Enygma`> just to work from Velocity with a java service that produces your blame results  
10:25 <pakhandibaba> Enygma`, I'll go through the apache velocity user manual  
10:25 <pakhandibaba> Enygma`, What else do you expect from a GSoC aspirant?  
10:25 <Enygma`> you`d need to have a look over XWiki's dev guide http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/ to help you on understanding what developing in XWiki means.  
10:25 <pakhandibaba> How can I increase my chances of selection?  
10:26 <Enygma`> the best thing you can/should do is to get to fix a couple of small issues from our issue tracker jira.xwiki.org  
10:26 <vmassol> convince us you understand the project and that you can produce something that will be finished by the end of hte GSOC ;)  
10:26 <Enygma`> create a Pull request  
10:26 <Enygma`> and get it applied  
10:26 <vmassol> yes demonstrating what you can do is the best  
10:26 <vmassol> actually this is documented I believe  
10:27 <pakhandibaba> I'll start with some small issues  
10:27 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/Guidelines  
10:27 <pakhandibaba> Can you suggest me some.  
10:27 <vmassol> please read that doc  
10:27 <pakhandibaba> okay  
10:31 <pakhandibaba> y  
10:40 <pakhandibaba> How to set up the dev env?  
10:41 <vmassol> [Reminder] 8.0RC1 needs to be released o the 3rd of March, i.e. in 2 days  
10:42 <vmassol> mflorea: you're the next RM according to http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/  
10:42 <vmassol> is that ok?  
10:42 <vmassol> we need to start converging starting from today in order to be able to release on the 3rd  
10:43 <pakhandibaba> vmassol, How to set up the dev env?  
10:45 <vmassol> pakhandibaba: see dev.xwiki.org  
10:45 <vmassol> the building part for example  
10:45 <vmassol> and the tools part  
10:45 <mflorea> vmassol: ok  
10:45 <vmassol> ok thanks, so it's in your hands now :)  
10:46 <vmassol> on my side I'll do a 6.4.8 release probably next week (waiting till last moment to have the max stuff in ità  
10:46 <vmassol> )  
10:46 <vmassol> unless caty insistes on doing it ;)  
10:47 <vmassol> \*insists  
10:49 <evalica> :) I can do it - if you want - I'm finishing now the 7.4.2 :) working on the docs + announcements  
10:49 <evalica> regarding 6.4.8 just let me know a final date, not a relative one :P  
10:53 <Enygma`> pakhandibaba: depends what dev environment you need. If you plan to write java components, then yes, get eclipse and read dev.xwiki.org. If you only want to focus on the UI (like the blame view project requires), all you need is an XWiki instance installed and running and a browser.  
10:54 <pakhandibaba> Enygma`, I am focussing on the blame view project  
10:54 <pakhandibaba> can you give me some relevant bugs.  
11:12 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
11:19 <Enygma`> pakhandibaba: you could also have a look at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/PaperCut  
11:19 <Enygma`> might be a place to start  
11:44 <vmassol> FTR noticed a bug with my @unstable check  
11:44 <vmassol> if I commit some new code with @Unstable 6.4.8, 7.4.3, 8.0RC1 , it tells me that the unstable anno shoudl be removed because 6.4.8 is old now  
11:44 <vmassol> ;)  
11:45 <vmassol> the rule is based on versions, not time...  
11:54 <pakhandibaba> has quit  
11:55 <pakhandibaba> has joined #xwiki  
11:56 <tmortagne> "the rule is based on versions, not time..." yes but introducing a new unstable API in a x.y.8 is not exactly a best practice :)  
11:56 <vmassol> right…  
11:56 <Nanduni\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:56 <vmassol> I put it only in 7.4.x in the end because of this  
11:56 <vmassol> (and master ofc)  
11:57 <vmassol> even though I'm sure xwiki users of 6.4.8 would have loved to have it  
11:57 <vmassol> s/would have loved/may have a need for it  
11:57 <pakhandibaba> has quit  
11:57 <vmassol> but yes it's a good safeguard  
11:58 <pakhandibaba> has joined #xwiki  
13:02 <Nanduni\_> has quit  
13:31 <pakhandibaba> Enygma`, How to set up the dev env needed for the project?  
13:32 <msmeria> has quit  
13:37 <Enygma`> pakhandibaba: you`d have to be a bit more specific, as I`ve previously mentioned.  
13:38 <pakhandibaba> I am interested in the blame view project . So What should I do to prove I am capable to complete that project?  
13:39 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:40 <pakhandibaba> Enygma`, ?  
13:43 <acotiuga> has quit  
13:47 <Enygma`> pakhandibaba: have a look at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/Guidelines#HIncreasingyourchancesofbeingacceptedasastudent  
13:48 <Enygma`> and tell me if that answers your question  
13:48 <msmeria> has quit  
13:49 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:49 <pakhandibaba> Enygma`, What about the dev env?  
13:49 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> has joined #xwiki  
13:50 <Enygma`> it`s XWiki`s dev environment  
13:50 <Enygma`> nothing special for GSoC  
13:50 <pakhandibaba> ok  
13:51 <Enygma`> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome and http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/ have all you need  
13:51 <Enygma`> pakhandibaba: and if you have specific questions, please feel free to ask  
13:52 <Enygma`> and, again, as mentioned, the blame view project is about creating an XWiki UI/Application, so all you really need is XWiki + a browser, nothing more  
13:53 <pakhandibaba> Enygma`, so should I solve bugs relevant to this or random?  
13:55 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> has quit  
13:56 <Enygma`> random is good as well. If you find something that can be considered relevant for this project, I guess it`s even better. We want to see that you can understand an issue and fix it, use git to work and to create pull requests, stuff like that.  
14:01 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
14:02 <msmeria> has quit  
14:07 <Trefex> has quit  
14:12 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
14:49 <Worm4047> has joined #xwiki  
14:52 <pakhandibaba> Enygma`, do I need to follow this http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  
14:54 <Slashman> has quit  
14:58 <Enygma`> pakhandibaba: not really, no  
14:58 <Enygma`> as I`ve said, you don`t have to \*build\* XWiki  
14:58 <Enygma`> just go through the dev documentation on building applications \*on top of\* XWiki  
15:01 <Worm4047> Hello everyone , I'm new here , someone please guide me as how to start so as to contribute .  
15:02 <Enygma`> Worm4047: like I`m telling pakhandibaba as well, the best place to start is reading the available online material at: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/Guidelines then http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing, then http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/  
15:03 <Enygma`> and for more help on development resources, practices, etc. always check out http://dev.xwiki.org  
15:04 <worm4047\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:04 <msmeria1> has quit  
15:04 <pakhandibaba> Enygma`, is this what you are saying http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/App+Within+Minutes+Application  
15:05 <Worm4047> has quit  
15:05 <Enygma`> pakhandibaba: that is a tool for non-developers/users to build simple (structured) applications on top of XWiki  
15:05 <Enygma`> so not really what you are looking for  
15:06 <Enygma`> I mean, sure, you can use it to get a first impression  
15:07 <Enygma`> but then you would need to grab the ropes and develop your own, custom code  
15:08 <worm4047\_> has quit  
15:08 <Enygma`> you need to understand \*how\* you can build applications in XWiki pages  
15:09 <vmassol> check the FAQ tutorial maybe?  
15:11 <Enygma`> you need to get to the level where you understand how to use velocity to communicate with the blame script service, to make it generate the data you need to present in the Blame View and how to package your work as an extension that is published on extensions.xwiki.org and installable by anyone curious to try it  
15:11 <Enygma`> of course, + the nice UI :)  
15:12 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:14 <Enygma`> another good overview of navigating through the documentation could be http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/GettingStartedWithXWiki  
15:33 <Enygma`> pakhandibaba: I`ve added this section to the student Guidelines http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/Guidelines#HGettingstartedwiththeXWikicommunity  
15:45 <Slashman> has quit  
15:49 <ujjwal> has joined #xwiki  
15:49 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
16:00 <ujjwal> has quit  
16:05 <vmassol> FYI I'll be installing mouseflow with Benjamin tomorrow on xwiki.org  
16:07 <martinus\_\_> is anyone know if TOC macro is expected to work with heading like ==head== instead of ==head ?  
16:08 <ujjwal> has joined #xwiki  
16:08 <vmassol> yes it should  
16:08 <vmassol> martinus\_\_:  
16:08 <vmassol> you're talking about the {{toc}} macro right?  
16:09 <vmassol> this macro works with the XDOM  
16:09 <vmassol>  and ==head== or ==head is parsed as a SectionBlock + HeadingBlock  
16:09 <martinus\_\_> yes, I'm getting this result : https://tc.ow2.org/bin/preview/wiki/OW2+users+and+entities+management+specifications  
16:10 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, display is kind of strange  
16:11 <vmassol> martinus\_\_: see http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Heading  
16:11 <vmassol> what's wrong?  
16:11 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, see the bullets on the first line ?  
16:12 <vmassol> there's only 1 bullet on the first line  
16:12 <martinus\_\_> Ah yes ?? So it's related to something on my side  
16:12 <martinus\_\_> caching or something  
16:13 <vmassol> this is what I see https://www.evernote.com/l/AHdJCkxHdvJGP5W8aFbvYBnbVMazNk8B6eY  
16:13 <vmassol> (martinus\_\_)  
16:14 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, ok yes, but on https://tc.ow2.org/bin/preview/wiki/OW2+users+and+entities+management+specifications ?  
16:14 <vmassol> private  
16:14 <vmassol> :)  
16:14 <martinus\_\_> ah, it's private, ok  
16:15 <martinus\_\_> (how can I see it then... even if I'm not logged in... hmm)à  
16:16 <vmassol> ip filtering?  
16:16 <martinus\_\_> I'm going to investigate  
16:18 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, Can I ask what content do you get exactly on that page ?  
16:19 <vmassol> login page  
16:19 <martinus\_\_> okay  
16:20 <tmortagne> evalica: Manish on the list is asking question about how to contribute to xwiki.org design, you will probably have a better answer than me :)  
16:23 <vmassol> tmortagne: he just need to create a proposal and propose it on the list  
16:23 <vmassol> (and he can use design.xwiki.org if he wants to write his proposal)  
16:23 <evalica> tmortagne: :) well we don't have the code in a repo so it's not based on PR. Also it's not very clear to me if he wants to do this as project or as part of the selection process.  
16:23 <tmortagne> could you guys answer him that since he asked on the list  
16:25 <vmassol> done  
16:25 <evalica> k
